DataElement.preferredName: Adaptive Behavior Assessment System Parent Rating Form Social Domain Composite Score Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric representation of the composite score for the Social Domain in the Adaptive Behavior Assessment System Parent Form.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Adaptive Behavior Assessment System, Parent Rating Form Social Domain Composite Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A comprehensive norm-referenced assessment of the adaptive skills of individuals ages 5 to 21 years that is used to evaluate children with intellectual and developmental disabilities. This form is completed by parents or others responsible for the child's primary care._A domain of the General Adaptive Composite Score that is made up of scores from social and leisure skills assessments._A single value that is calculated from multiple scores. This composite score can then be used as a single variable in further analysis and comparison.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Adaptive Behavior Assessment System, Parent Rating Form Social Domain
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A comprehensive norm-referenced assessment of the adaptive skills of individuals ages 5 to 21 years that is used to evaluate children with intellectual and developmental disabilities. This form is completed by parents or others responsible for the child's primary care.:A domain of the General Adaptive Composite Score that is made up of scores from social and leisure skills assessments.

Concepts.longName: Adaptive Behavior Assessment System, Parent Rating Form
Concepts.definition: A comprehensive norm-referenced assessment of the adaptive skills of individuals ages 5 to 21 years that is used to evaluate children with intellectual and developmental disabilities. This form is completed by parents or others responsible for the child's primary care.
A domain of the General Adaptive Composite Score that is made up of scores from social and leisure skills assessments.

Property.preferredDefinition: A single value that is calculated from multiple scores. This composite score can then be used as a single variable in further analysis and comparison.

Concepts.definition: A single value that is calculated from multiple scores. This composite score can then be used as a single variable in further analysis and comparison.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity calculated from data in multiple variables in order to form reliable and valid measures from the Adaptive Behavior Assessment System.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
